queries.description: When using kube-apiserver command, the '--insecure-port' flag should be defined and set to 0

files.expected_value: --insecure-port flag should be defined and set to 0

queries.query_name: Pod Security Policy Admission Control Plugin Not Set
queries.description: When using kube-apiserver command, the '--enable-admission-plugins' flag should have 'PodSecurityPolicy' plugin and the plugin should be correctly configured in AdmissionControl Config file
Containers should not run with allowPrivilegeEscalation in order to prevent them from gaining more privileges than their parent process

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-etcd}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{etcd}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{release-name-api}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kube-apiserver}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{release-name}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{syncer}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{release-name-controller}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kube-controller-manager}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false

queries.query_name: Volume Mount With OS Directory Write Permissions
queries.description: Containers can mount sensitive folders from the hosts, giving them potentially dangerous access to critical host configurations and binaries.

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-etcd}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{etcd}}.volumeMounts.name={{data}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true

queries.query_name: Always Pull Images Admission Control Plugin Not Set
queries.description: When using kube-apiserver command, the '--enable-admission-plugins' flag should have 'AlwaysPullImages' plugin and the plugin should be correctly configured in AdmissionControl Config file
When using kube-apiserver command, the 'audit-log-path' flag should be defined
When using kube-apiserver command, the '--audit-policy-file' flag should be defined
When using kube-apiserver command, the 'authorization-mode' flag should have 'Node' mode
Containers should only run as non-root user. This limits the exploitability of security misconfigurations and restricts an attacker's possibilities in case of compromise

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-controller}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kube-controller-manager}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{release-name-etcd}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{etcd}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{release-name-api}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kube-apiserver}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{release-name}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{syncer}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true

queries.description: Check if containers are running with low UID, which might cause conflicts with the host's user table.

queries.query_name: Encryption Provider Config Is Not Defined
queries.description: When using kube-apiserver commands, the '--encryption-provider-config' flag should be defined and the encryption should be correctly configured in Encryption Configuration file
When using kube-apiserver command, the 'kubelet-certificate-authority' flag should be set

queries.query_name: Kubelet Client Certificate Or Key Not Set
queries.description: When using kube-apiserver command, the 'kubelet-client-key' and 'kubelet-client-certificate' flags should be set
Memory limits should be defined for each container. This prevents potential resource exhaustion by ensuring that containers consume not more than the designated amount of memory
Memory requests should be defined for each container. This allows the kubelet to reserve the requested amount of system resources and prevents over-provisioning on individual nodes
Containers should drop 'ALL' or at least 'NET_RAW' capabilities

queries.query_name: Node Restriction Admission Control Plugin Not Set
queries.description: When using kube-apiserver command, the --enable-admission-plugins flag should have 'NodeRestriction' plugin and the plugin should be correctly configured in AdmissionControl Config file
The permission to create pods in a cluster should be restricted because it allows privilege escalation.

files.expected_value: metadata.name=release-name.rules.verbs should not contain the value 'create' when metadata.name=release-name.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'
files.actual_value: metadata.name=release-name.rules.verbs contains the value 'create' and metadata.name=release-name.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'

queries.description: Roles or ClusterRoles with RBAC permissions to attach to containers via 'kubectl attach' could be abused by attackers to read log output (stdout, stderr) and send input data (stdin) to running processes. Additionally, it would allow a malicious user to attach to a privileged container resulting in a privilege escalation attack. To prevent this, the 'pods/attach' verb should not be used in production environments

Roles or ClusterRoles with RBAC permissions to run commands in containers via 'kubectl exec' could be abused by attackers to execute malicious code in case of compromise. To prevent this, the 'pods/exec' verb should not be used in production environments

Roles or ClusterRoles with RBAC permissions to port-forward into pods can open socket-level communication channels to containers. In case of compromise, attackers may abuse this for direct communication that bypasses network security restrictions

queries.query_name: RBAC Roles with Read Secrets Permissions
queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles with get/watch/list RBAC permissions on Kubernetes secrets are dangerous and should be avoided. In case of compromise, attackers could abuse these roles to access sensitive data, such as passwords, tokens and keys

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name}}.rules[0] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name}}.rules[0] is granted read access (verbs: create, delete, patch, update, get, list, watch) to Secrets objects

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-job}}.rules[0] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-job}}.rules[0] is granted read access (verbs: create, get, list) to Secrets objects

queries.description: Check if Readiness Probe is not configured.
Containers should be configured with a secure Seccomp profile to restrict potentially dangerous syscalls

queries.query_name: Security Context Deny Admission Control Plugin Not Set
queries.description: When using kube-apiserver command, the '--enable-admission-plugins' flag should have 'SecurityContextDeny' plugin and the plugin should be correctly configured in AdmissionControl Config file when 'PodSecurityPolicy' plugin is not set

files.expected_value: --enable-admission-plugins flag should contain 'SecurityContextDeny' plugin if 'PodSecurityPolicy' plugin should not be set

queries.query_name: Service Account Token Automount Not Disabled
queries.description: Service Account Tokens are automatically mounted even if not necessary

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false
metadata.name={{release-name-job}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false

queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles when binded, should not use get, list or watch as verbs

files.expected_value: The metadata.name={{release-name}}.rules.verbs should not contain the following verbs: [["create", "delete", "patch", "update", "get", "list", "watch"]]
The metadata.name={{release-name-job}}.rules.verbs should not contain the following verbs: [["create", "get", "list"]]

queries.description: CPU limits should be set because if the system has CPU time free, a container is guaranteed to be allocated as much CPU as it requests
CPU requests should be set to ensure the sum of the resource requests of the scheduled Containers is less than the capacity of the node
